alerts.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Watch issued June 7 at 7:28PM CDT until June 8 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
alerts.description:
THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE HAS ISSUED SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH
389 IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT SUNDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING AREAS

IN ARKANSAS THIS WATCH INCLUDES 9 COUNTIES

IN SOUTH CENTRAL ARKANSAS

UNION

IN SOUTHWEST ARKANSAS

COLUMBIA              HEMPSTEAD             HOWARD
LAFAYETTE             LITTLE RIVER          MILLER
NEVADA                SEVIER

IN OKLAHOMA THIS WATCH INCLUDES 1 COUNTY

IN SOUTHEAST OKLAHOMA

MCCURTAIN

IN TEXAS THIS WATCH INCLUDES 7 COUNTIES

IN NORTHEAST TEXAS

BOWIE                 CAMP                  CASS
FRANKLIN              MORRIS                RED RIVER
TITUS

THIS INCLUDES THE CITIES OF ASHDOWN, ATLANTA, BOGATA, BRADLEY,
BROKEN BOW, CLARKSVILLE, DAINGERFIELD, DE QUEEN, DIERKS,
EL DORADO, HOPE, HUGHES SPRINGS, IDABEL, LEWISVILLE, LINDEN,
LONE STAR, MAGNOLIA, MINERAL SPRINGS, MOUNT PLEASANT,
MOUNT VERNON, NAPLES, NASHVILLE, OMAHA, PITTSBURG, PRESCOTT,
QUEEN CITY, STAMPS, TEXARKANA, AND TEXARKANA.

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 8:10PM CDT until June 8 at 7:17PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River At Trinidad affecting Henderson and Navarro
Counties.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River at Trinidad.

* WHEN...Until tomorrow evening.

* IMPACTS...At 37.0 feet, Minor flooding to woodlands and low land
areas will occur on the right bank of the river.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 35.8 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 33.0 feet.
- Flood stage is 33.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
tomorrow morning and continue falling to 19.9 feet Thursday
evening.
alerts.areaDesc: Henderson, TX; Navarro, TX

alerts.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 7 at 8:37PM CDT until June 8 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Midland/Odessa TX
alerts.description:
* WHAT...Temperatures up to 105 expected.

* WHERE...Andrews, Crane, Ector, Martin, Midland, and Winkler
Counties.

* WHEN...From 1 PM to 9 PM CDT Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential
for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or
participating in outdoor activities.

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 8:46PM CDT until June 12 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Neches River Near Alto affecting Houston, Anderson, Angelina and
Cherokee Counties.

For the Neches River...including Neches, Alto, Diboll, Rockland...
Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Neches River near Alto.

* WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Boat ramps and picnic areas near the river
will begin to flood. Ranchers should move cattle and equipment
near the river to higher ground.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 17.0 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 8:15 PM CDT Saturday was 17.2 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.0
feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below
flood stage early Wednesday morning.
- Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
17.0 feet on 02/16/2010.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Anderson, TX; Angelina, TX; Cherokee, TX; Houston, TX

alerts.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 7 at 1:48PM MDT until June 8 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
alerts.description:
* WHAT...Temperatures up to 106 expected.

* WHERE...Eastern/Central El Paso County, Rio Grande Valley of
Eastern El Paso/Western Hudspeth Counties, Rio Grande Valley of
Eastern Hudspeth County, and Western El Paso County.

* WHEN...From noon to 8 PM MDT Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses.
alerts.areaDesc: Western El Paso County; Eastern/Central El Paso County; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso/Western Hudspeth Counties; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern Hudspeth County

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 9:07PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River near Moss Bluff affecting Liberty and Chambers
Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor,
Goodrich, Moss Bluff, Liberty...Moderate flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River near Moss Bluff.

* WHEN...Until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 15.2 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins in the
vicinity of the gage.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 13.3 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 9.2 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 8:30 PM CDT Saturday was 13.3 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 14.2 feet
Wednesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter.
- Flood stage is 12.2 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
14.2 feet on 10/22/1994.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Chambers, TX; Liberty, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 8:45PM CDT until June 10 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Sabine River Near Mineola affecting Smith and Wood Counties.

For the Sabine River...including Mineola, Hawkins, Gladewater,
Longview, Beckville, Logansport...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Sabine River near Mineola.

* WHEN...From this afternoon to late Monday night.

* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Expect flooding of secondary roadways with
picnic and recreational areas flooded as well.  Also expect
flooded boat ramps as well.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 12.9 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.0
feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage
Monday morning.
- Flood stage is 14.0 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
15.1 feet on 02/27/2016.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Smith, TX; Wood, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 9:06PM CDT until June 9 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River at Riverside affecting Polk, San Jacinto, Trinity
and Walker Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor,
Goodrich, Moss Bluff, Liberty...Moderate flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River at Riverside.

* WHEN...Until early Monday morning.

* IMPACTS...At 134.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues with the
boat ramp in the Deep River Plantation Subdivision in Walker
County inundated. Backwater flooding up Thomas Lake in Walker
County floods the boat ramp in the Green Rich Shores Subdivision
in Walker County.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 133.9 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 133.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 8:30 PM CDT Saturday was 134.5 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 131.0 feet
Thursday evening.
- Flood stage is 133.5 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
134.0 feet on 07/26/2024.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Polk, TX; San Jacinto, TX; Trinity, TX; Walker, TX

- Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 12.7 feet

alerts.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 7 at 10:23PM CDT by NWS Amarillo TX
alerts.description:
At 1023 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7
miles northwest of Vega, moving southeast at 40 mph.

HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around
unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is
possible.

Locations impacted include...
Vega, Adrian, and Wildorado.

This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 21 and 48.
alerts.areaDesc: Oldham; Deaf Smith

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Angelina River Near Lufkin affecting Nacogdoches and Angelina
Counties.

For the Angelina River...including Alto, Lufkin...Minor flooding is
forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Angelina River near Lufkin.

* WHEN...Until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 165.0 feet, Expect flooding to continue for several
days with the majority of the gravel access roadway flooded.
Boaters and four wheel-operators should use caution traversing
both upstream and downstream on the Angelina River as currents can
become swift and turbulent.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 163.6 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 158.5 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 8:15 PM CDT Saturday was 163.7 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 163.6
feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise to 163.7
feet early Tuesday afternoon. Additional rises are possible
thereafter.
- Flood stage is 161.0 feet.
- Flood History...No available flood history.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Angelina, TX; Nacogdoches, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 9:06PM CDT until June 9 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River at Riverside affecting Polk, San Jacinto, Trinity
and Walker Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor,
Goodrich, Moss Bluff, Liberty...Moderate flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River at Riverside.

* WHEN...Until early Monday morning.

* IMPACTS...At 134.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues with the
boat ramp in the Deep River Plantation Subdivision in Walker
County inundated. Backwater flooding up Thomas Lake in Walker
County floods the boat ramp in the Green Rich Shores Subdivision
in Walker County.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 133.9 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 133.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 8:30 PM CDT Saturday was 134.5 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 131.0 feet
Thursday evening.
- Flood stage is 133.5 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
134.0 feet on 07/26/2024.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Polk, TX; San Jacinto, TX; Trinity, TX; Walker, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 9:08PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River at Liberty affecting Liberty County.

For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor,
Goodrich, Moss Bluff, Liberty...Moderate flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is
forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River at Liberty.

* WHEN...Until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Major lowland flooding begins as homes in
several subdivisions above Liberty begin flooding. Extensive
flooding over much of Liberty County can be expected with each
incremental rise in the river.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 27.5 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 8:15 PM CDT Saturday was 27.5 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 28.2 feet early
Wednesday afternoon. Additional rises are possible
thereafter.
- Flood stage is 26.0 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
28.2 feet on 07/03/2004.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Liberty, TX

Trinity River near Moss Bluff affecting Liberty and Chambers
Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor,
Goodrich, Moss Bluff, Liberty...Moderate flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River near Moss Bluff.

* WHEN...Until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 15.2 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins in the
vicinity of the gage.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 13.3 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 9.2 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 8:30 PM CDT Saturday was 13.3 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 14.2 feet
Wednesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter.
- Flood stage is 12.2 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
14.2 feet on 10/22/1994.

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Angelina River Near Lufkin affecting Nacogdoches and Angelina
Counties.

For the Angelina River...including Alto, Lufkin...Minor flooding is
forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Angelina River near Lufkin.

* WHEN...Until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 165.0 feet, Expect flooding to continue for several
days with the majority of the gravel access roadway flooded.
Boaters and four wheel-operators should use caution traversing
both upstream and downstream on the Angelina River as currents can
become swift and turbulent.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 163.6 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 158.5 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 8:15 PM CDT Saturday was 163.7 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 163.6
feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise to 163.7
feet early Tuesday afternoon. Additional rises are possible
thereafter.
- Flood stage is 161.0 feet.
- Flood History...No available flood history.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Angelina, TX; Nacogdoches, TX

Cherokee Counties.

Minor flooding is forecast.

will begin to flood. Ranchers should move cattle and equipment
near the river to higher ground.

ending at 8:15 PM CDT Saturday was 17.2 feet.

feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below
flood stage early Wednesday morning.

17.0 feet on 02/16/2010.
